rsoi 0.3.1
  • Reference
  • Changelog

rsoi

An R package to download the most up to date Southern Oscillation Index, Oceanic Nino Index and North Pacific Gyre Oscillation data.

Installation

install.packages("rsoi")

library(rsoi)
library(ggplot2)
#> Warning: package 'rsoi' was built under R version 3.5.1

Usage

enso <- download_enso()
enso
#> # A tibble: 826 x 7
#>    Date        Year Month     ONI phase                SOI   NPGO
#>    <date>     <dbl> <ord>   <dbl> <fct>              <dbl>  <dbl>
#>  1 1950-01-01  1950 Jan    NA     <NA>                  NA -2.19 
#>  2 1950-02-01  1950 Feb    -1.34  Cool Phase/El Nino    NA -1.45 
#>  3 1950-03-01  1950 Mar    -1.17  Cool Phase/El Nino    NA -0.965
#>  4 1950-04-01  1950 Apr    -1.18  Cool Phase/El Nino    NA -0.859
#>  5 1950-05-01  1950 May    -1.07  Cool Phase/El Nino    NA -0.634
#>  6 1950-06-01  1950 Jun    -0.85  Cool Phase/El Nino    NA -0.581
#>  7 1950-07-01  1950 Jul    -0.533 Cool Phase/El Nino    NA -0.742
#>  8 1950-08-01  1950 Aug    -0.423 Neutral Phase         NA -0.549
#>  9 1950-09-01  1950 Sep    -0.383 Neutral Phase         NA -0.602
#> 10 1950-10-01  1950 Oct    -0.443 Neutral Phase         NA  0.119
#> # ... with 816 more rows

Or for index specific data use the argument:

soi <- download_enso(climate_idx = "soi")
soi
#> # A tibble: 814 x 5
#>    Date       Month  Year   SOI SOI_3MON_AVG
#>    <date>     <ord> <dbl> <dbl>        <dbl>
#>  1 1951-01-01 Jan    1951   1.5       NA    
#>  2 1951-02-01 Feb    1951   0.9        0.767
#>  3 1951-03-01 Mar    1951  -0.1        0.167
#>  4 1951-04-01 Apr    1951  -0.3       -0.367
#>  5 1951-05-01 May    1951  -0.7       -0.267
#>  6 1951-06-01 Jun    1951   0.2       -0.5  
#>  7 1951-07-01 Jul    1951  -1         -0.333
#>  8 1951-08-01 Aug    1951  -0.2       -0.767
#>  9 1951-09-01 Sep    1951  -1.1       -0.767
#> 10 1951-10-01 Oct    1951  -1         -0.967
#> # ... with 804 more rows

And we can plot these values using ggplot2 nicely

ggplot(enso, aes(x = Date, y = NPGO)) +
  geom_line() +
  theme_minimal() +
  labs(x = "Year", y = "North Pacific Gyre Oscillation")

Inspired by

The idea for this package borrows heavily from the rpdo package. The initial efforts by these authors are gratefully acknowledged. The rpdo github page can be found here: rpdo

Data Sources

  • Southern Oscillation Index https://www.ncdc.noaa.gov/teleconnections/enso/indicators/soi/
  • Oceanic Nino Index data http://www.cpc.ncep.noaa.gov/products/analysis_monitoring/ensostuff/detrend.nino34.ascii.txt
  • Northern Pacific Gyre Oscillation http://www.o3d.org/npgo/data/NPGO.txt

Helpful References

In Watching for El Niño and La Niña, NOAA Adapts to Global Warming

L’Heureux, M. L., Collins, D. C., & Hu, Z.-Z. (2012, March.). Linear trends in sea surface temperature of the tropical Pacific Ocean and implications for the El Niño-Southern Oscillation. Climate Dynamics, 1–14. doi:10.1007/s00382-012-1331-2

The Victoria mode in the North Pacific linking extratropical sea level pressure variations to ENSO
